intro: Thelypodium eucosmum, commonly known as the European thelypodium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are linear and arranged alternately along the stem, contributing to its delicate appearance. Thelypodium eucosmum is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
